links.purpose: Mobile filename frontload contract (Android Project Files UI)

body.title: Mobile Filename Frontload Contract (Android Project Files UI)

problem.symptom: Android Project Files list truncates filenames, making multiple .mips.json files indistinguishable at a glance.
impact: breaks 'cavemen with power tools' usability constraint
adds hesitation friction during routine ops

contract: All Project Files MUST have first 24 characters unique and semantic.
Filenames MUST start with a stable slot prefix: MB__00, MB__01, MB__03, MB__90, etc.
Meaning must be front-loaded (do not rely on suffix timestamps).
Sentinel remains source of truth; filenames exist to reduce mobile friction.

recommended_slots.meaning: Active State / Sentinel (source of truth pointer)

integration_points.add: Project Files Naming Contract section + slot prefixes as canonical names
One-line rule: 'Mobile UI truncates filenames; trust slot prefixes MB__00/01/03/90.'

checks: In Android Project Files list view, each file is uniquely identifiable from the left/truncated portion.
User can tell CorePack vs External Intel without opening files.
validation.rollback: Revert filenames; no content changes required.

provenance.source: User observed mobile UI truncation ambiguity; prior chat solution not captured into Delta.
